header: Is It Better to Be Dead?

verse: I ·realized [saw; observed] the reason people ·work hard [toil] and try to succeed: They are jealous of ·each other [their neighbors]. This, too, is useless [1:2], like chasing the wind.
A poor but wise ·boy [youth] is better than a foolish but old king who doesn’t listen to advice [Prov. 11:14; 15:22; 20:18; 24:6].
The ·boy [youth] became king. He had been born poor in the kingdom and had even gone to prison before becoming king.
I ·watched [saw; observed] all the people who ·lived on earth [walked under the sun; 1:3] follow ·him and make him their king [or the next youth who replaced the first youth/him].

·Many followed him at first [There was no end to all the people, to all those whom he led], but later, they did not like him, either. ·So fame and power are [This is] useless [1:2], like chasing the wind.
